reviews.text: Great food and service! Our server Mameiw was amazing!

I've ordered this for takeout a bunch but this is my first time in the restaurant - what a lovely experience. My favorite dish has always been the spicy udon but the chive pancakes were also a hit! Thank you Mameiw for your great service!
Fabulous appetizers served by the fabulous Mameiw! Spring rolls and Massaman chive dumplings!
Best crab rangoons i‚Äôve ever had. Shoutout to Mameiw - amazing service!
Great meal and service from Mameiw
Our experience at Thep was so good! The pad kee mao was delicious. Thank you to our server Mameiw for being so attentive.
Loved the food, nice ambiente.

Lovely restaurant & Kade is amazing server

NOTE AFTER I GOT HOME: I got a free drink for this review. The waiter requested to see me type it in and send it (she took a photo) and asked me to include her name. Still amazing food, just noting that for transparency!
Best pad Thai on the block! Their dishes have great flavor. I love the vibe inside too - clean, and cool hanging plants. Our server Mamein was lovely!

From being seated to paying the bill, all excellent. Their meals satisfy completely and their service stands out. This spot balances style and atmosphere well. Their service team was adequately attentive. The staff was helpful, and I plan to return when in town.
Thank you to Kade for great service.
Our server Kade was great. Very yummy food and good vibes! Great spot for a date night
Yada took such good care of us üíï Friendly, fast, and always smiling! Will definitely come back ü´∂üáπüá≠‚Äù
Kade was great
Loved the food, Yada so friendly and full of good energyü´∂üèª
Yada was so sweet and welcoming! She made the whole visit feel special. The curry was incredible, rich, and perfectly spiced. Would recommend.

Yada greeted me with her usual kindness and bright smile. She always makes the place feel like home. This time I tried the Pad See Ew, and it was absolutely perfect: smoky, slightly sweet, and full of that comforting wok flavor that‚Äôs hard to find anywhere else. The noodles were soft but not overdone, and the sauce was balanced beautifully. Thep Thai continues to be one of my favorite spots in the city

Loved my visit to Thep Thai!
Yada was incredibly sweet and welcoming...she made the whole experience better. The atmosphere was cozy and inviting, and every dish looked amazing, but I tried the Khao Soi and it was great!. Balanced flavors, rich and comforting. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back soon!
Their vegan pad Thai is amazing. We go every time we visit nyc.
Anna is amazing excellent service food and atmosphere amazing highly recommend!!
Anna was fantastic!!!!!! Good delicious!!!!
Food was great, Gift was an excellent server!
I had a lovely time at Thep! Gift was an amazing server
Gift
Gift was our server and she was super sweet and helpful!
The food was amazing! I got the Pad Kee Mao which was delicious. Our server Gift was very attentive and made sure our whole experience was amazing!
gift was a great server and provided delicious recommendations!
Gift was such a good server and recommended great dishes.
Shoutout to Yada the sweetest Thai server ever! üíñ She made us laugh, kept the drinks coming, and made sure we felt at home.

Thai is my all time go to Thai restaurant on the Upper East Side! If I were to show you my Grubhub history I have ordered Thep Thai at least once a week!!

All the items on their menu are amazing but my favorite is the Queen of Siam! Their in person experience is even better with bigger menu and amazing stuff! Mameiw our server was wonderful. Highly recommended spot
The Pad see eiw was great and Minnie was great with fast service!
Minnie was awesome, food was great

Great green curry! Also customized outside of standard menu.

Mameiw is quick
This place was so cute! Minnie was our server and she was on it, even though it was so busy! The service was great and the food was so yummy.

The food was delicious, full of flavor and perfectly balanced spices. The ambience was warm and inviting, creating a relaxed and enjoyable dining experience. And service was excellent ‚Äî friendly, attentive, and made us feel truly welcome. Gift was great
Amazingggggg wowww OMG!!! Mameiw is the best server!!!!
Just had dinner at this Thai restaurant and it was fantastic! The food was fresh, flavorful, and perfectly spiced ‚Äî every dish tasted authentic and well-balanced.
Minnie is an amazing server!
Gift helped us today. Food and service was wonderful. This restaurant has great vegetarian options.
Minnie was a great server!
Love the seating and food menu! Minnie was a great host.
Wonderful dining experience, Gift was a great waitress!
I‚Äôve never had Thai food so good. The aroma and the taste of the food made my heart soar. Gift was the absolute best‚ÄîI would come twice in one day!!!
Very nice atmosphere! Gift was a great server
I ordered a pad thai to go. Not a single vegetable in the dish, just a few bean sprouts... Outrageous for a $20 pad thai!!! Please respect your takeout customers.
great food, and service is great, shoutout to Minnie
Highly recommend spicy udon. We loved our server Minnie!
Amazing food, amazing ambiance, amazing staff. Ask for Minnie! Highly recommend.

I have been dreaming of the chicken Pad Thai at THEP Thai. The food is delicious, service is always excellent, and the ambiance is very modern and trendy. Our waitress Four took excellent care of us and made our date night memorable. THEP thai is our favorite Thai restaurant to eat at in NYC.
Kade was a great server!

Four is great.
Food is great.
Atmosphere is really good.

Thep Thai truly stands out, not just for its vibrant atmosphere, but for the exceptional quality and flavor depth found across its entire menu, especially in its vegetarian and chicken offerings.

For those seeking plant-based dishes, Thep is a revelation. The menu is clearly labeled with excellent vegan options, and the kitchen handles substitutions perfectly. The Vegan Pad See Ew with tofu is arguably the best I‚Äôve ever had‚Äîrich, smoky, and perfectly textured. Don't skip the Avocado Massaman Curry (available vegetarian/vegan), which is wonderfully creamy, savory, and loaded with tender sweet potato. The commitment to flavorful, authentic vegan food here is top-tier.

On the non-vegetarian side, the chicken dishes are equally impressive. The Chicken Pad Thai is a classic for a reason, hitting that perfect balance of sweet and tangy tamarind flavor. However, the real showstopper is the Chicken Khao Soi (Northern Thai Egg Noodles)‚Äîthe creamy coconut curry broth is incredibly deep and comforting, and the chicken (often bone-in, which adds to the authenticity) is cooked to perfection. It's an absolute must-try.

Whether you're visiting for a comforting chicken classic or looking for sophisticated, flavorful vegan Thai, Thep delivers consistently high quality and is highly recommended.

Minnie was awesome to help us with our order. A big thanks to her and entire staff for making our lunch good

I love THEP Thai. I‚Äôve been here so many times and I was last here for my friends birthday dinner.  It‚Äôs my favorite Thai food on the UES. We were a group of 10+ and we had called to get a reservation earlier in the week for a Friday night and they were able to accommodate.

I got a Thai iced tea and the khao soi. I love the food here (have tried most of the menu items).

The service was super quick and friendly - we had a nice lady named Four as our host/server.

Love this place and will be back!

Recently dined at Thep Thai and had a wonderful experience overall. The Massaman curry was absolutely delicious, rich in flavor, tasty, and with a quantity generous enough for two people to share comfortably. The chive pancake was another highlight; it was so good that we ended up ordering it twice, though it was a bit softer than expected. The chive dumpling with Massaman curry was decent, but we felt the curry portion was slightly less for four dumplings. Beyond the food, the ambience was warm and welcoming, adding to the enjoyable dining experience.

Servers were very nice and the service was TOP TIER. Our Servers Minnie was an awesome host. She checked in regularly with us and continued to make sure all was well. I would definitely come back here again for a THIRD time. Highly recommend the sticky rice! ;)
The Tom Yum soup, Pad Thai , dumplings and drinks were all absolutely delicious ‚Äî full of authentic Thai flavor! Quick service and very friendly staff. I‚Äôll definitely come back! ‚ò∫Ô∏èüçú
Such a great spot.  The food was delicious - especially the chef‚Äôs specials.  We were all taken back by the food presentation - such beautiful and creative bowls and platters.

We ordered Pad Thai, Pineapple Fried Rice, and Green Curry. They were all delicious! Minnie was very nice and made the experience even better.

We came during lunch time and it was chill~

This place was recommended to me by a friend, specifically for the hand pulled noodles‚Ä¶ and it did not disappoint! Loved that they had available seating outside without a wait! The spicy udon was delicious, the noodles in the pad Thai were different than usual but I was a fan! Overall, would come again :) Nuy was the best!

Nice ambience and nice food with ample of vegetarian options as well. They were able to cater Jain food too. We ordered Basil Fried Rice, Papaya Salad, Masaman Curry and Drunken noodles. The curry was a bit on the sweeter side. Might be better to mention the spice level next time. Basil Fried rice and Drunken noodles were on point. They are also gluten free.

The ambience is nice and the place is always packed on weekends so better to reserve in advance and go. Only giving 4 star because the place is bit on the pricier side and the portion size might not justify it. Apart from this, we were given a table that was shared with other people.

Friendly staff. Nice ambience place. Not so spacious between tables. Order food through QR code, no menu book. Food came out pretty quick. They did the to go box for your leftover. Bathroom in the back.

Bu restoran Ilk Thai denememdi. Restoranƒ±n giri≈üi √ßok dar olduƒüu i√ßin beklemek biraz problemli oluyor, Rezervasyonumuza  bir iki dakika ge√ß kalmamƒ±za raƒümen masaya ge√ßmek i√ßin beklemek zorunda kaldƒ±k. Ancak lezzetler ve sunumlar √ßok g√ºzeldi. Servis yapan garsonlar biraz daha g√ºl√ºmseyebilir.

Sat at the bar, really good service from bartender.  The tom yum soup was amazing, probably my favorite. The pad kee mao + shrimp was probably the next best. The only note was the duck was a little gamey for me.

Great food and great service. I had a steak over fried rice and my friends pineapple fried rice. We also shared an appetizer sampler. All were delicious. They could also accommodate substitution requests for some ingredients easily. Thoroughly enjoyable dinner experience. I would definitely come back to try other dishes.

Great Thai spot in UES, open late and cute inside. Our server, Gift, was helpful, the food came out fast, and the flavor was there. Pad Thai was super flavorful, cooked well and good portion. The chicken cashew king was also flavorful. The rice that comes with it isn‚Äôt quite enough, but overall everything was good.

We had an amazing experience here with Minnie. Party of 11 and we were seated immediately. Food came out quickly hot and fresh and was delicious. Our waitress was very sweet and helpful. Would definitely recommend.
Food was quite flavorful and decent portions! Minny was very sweet and helped us in deciding what to get. Service was fast

Thep Thai is the best Thai food in UES and one of the best in the city. I've been eating here for the last 5 years, I'll always recommend Thep Thai. They are very efficient, food is very tasty, great service and nice atmosphere. Best Thai Food in UES.

Gift was our server, she was super friendly and attentive. 5 stars.

Great experience at Thep Thai! The food was flavorful and came out quickly, and the service was top-notch. Our waitress, Four, was incredibly friendly and attentive ‚Äî she really made us feel welcome. Will definitely be back!
Really good food, recommend the chive dumpling massaman! The bartender provided excellent service and his drinks are really good. The server named Gift was super nice too!
Lovely staff. Great vibes. Amazing food. Everything we had here tasted superb! Highly recommend. Will be back for sure!
Delicious food. Excellent presentation. Great drinks good vibe. Our server Kade was amazing too. I will be coming back again.

THEP Thai in the Upper East Side really sets to impress. They have a beautiful interior while also a clean and cozy outdoor seating perfect for the warm weather. Definitely recommend starting your night out with their seasonal cocktails. It‚Äôs hits the spot and tastes amazing. Food was delicious and felt authentic. Every dish was full of flavor which you can tell they care about what they‚Äôre serving. Staffs were super friendly and on point without being too much. THEP Thai is a great spot with good vibes, great food, and wonderful drinks. Thinking Thai tonight? You already know where to go.

Food was exceptional, one of the best NYC Thai restaurants. Our server Mamein was very friendly and asked us about dietary restrictions which was helpful for us being vegetarian. We got the chive dumplings, pad kee Mao, and basil fried rice. The chive dumplings come with a curry sauce that‚Äôs very tasty. 10/10 would recommend

Everything from the food to the service was top notch! I would definitely come back here again! Try the papaya salad and their watermelon cocktail. I also got the pad Thai with shrimp but ate it so fast I forgot to take a picture, but the shrimp were huge!! I would definitely come back!!
Great and fast service. The food was very flavorful! I got the Queen of Basil stir fry and it had a nice kick; they also kindly took out the onions at my request. Would come again. Gift
This place is great Thai food in NYC!! Ploy is an amazing server, super sweet and accommodating. We got 2 mains and an appetizer and all 3 were great! Highly recommend the pineapple fried rice
We ordered Papaya Salad, Pad Kee Mao and the Massaman curry and they were all delicious! Nuy is so nice and made the experience amazing.
Beautiful restaurant with a great vibe and delicious  Thai food. We all had Khao Soi which was amazing, shared spring rolls and spicy fried rice that was great!

We ordered the Red Curry with Tofu and the Spicy Udon Noodles with Tofu, and both dishes were absolutely delicious! The udon noodles were packed with flavor and the perfect level of spice‚Äîeasily the second-best I‚Äôve ever had. The red curry was rich, comforting, and really well-balanced.

Service was prompt and attentive, which made the dining experience even better. I truly enjoyed my meal, thank you, Thep Thai!
Loved my visit to Theo! I had the crab Rangoon, spicy Udon and Thai Tee and everything was fabulous! Our server Four took great care of us. The place was so busy but our service was speedy!

Quiet and nice ambience in the restaurant. Server staff Ploy was highly attentive and good with recommendations! Food was not bad, but spicy udon was a little bit too salty/saucy for my personal taste buds.
Come here often - beautiful atmosphere and decor, and the food and drinks are always delicious. Even their menu is well designed. It is always vibrant and full so good idea to make reservations.

I had spicy pork belly with rice, basil, and a sunny side egg and it was so good. The food was so flavorful and the ambiance was really nice and aesthetic with the hanging plants and warm lighting. Our server Mind was so kind and cheerful! I would come here again for sure!!

I initially came here for a work lunch but since then I‚Äôve been back several times. I absolutely love their food. From their basil fried rice to their pad Thai and I recently tried their spicy udon and it was delicious. I often come here just to take out and I‚Äôm really impressed with the service and the staff. You know when you go to certain restaurants and the menu doesn‚Äôt really taste the same. However, this one never skips a beat.

We had such a wonderful dining experience at Thep Restaurant, thanks to our amazing waiter Mameiw! From the moment we were seated, she was friendly, attentive, and made us feel truly welcomed. She gave great recommendations from the menu and checked in just the right amount  never rushed, always kind. The food was absolutely delicious, and her positive energy made the whole experience even better. It‚Äôs rare to get service that feels this genuine and thoughtful. Thank you, Mameiw, for making our night so special! We‚Äôll definitely be coming back.

THEP Thai offers traditional Thai cuisine while also weaving in modern touches. The space itself feels serene and intentional, and the staff made the whole experience feel welcoming and easy. There‚Äôs a lot of thought put into the menu, not just in taste, but in how it brings pieces of Thai culture to the table.

We started with cocktails, my friend had the Mango Sticky Rice , made with rice-infused vodka, pandan liqueur, coconut rum, mango, lime, and milk. The drink captures the essence of khao niew mamuang, a classic Thai dessert of sticky rice with sweet mango and coconut milk. The pandan liqueur adds  a soft vanilla-like aroma, which is commonly found in Southeast Asian sweets. It was smooth and not overly sweet.

I ordered the THEP Mule. The vodka was infused with Thai basil, an herb used in many central and northeastern Thai dishes. Unlike sweet basil, Thai basil has a slightly spicy, anise-like flavor that pairs beautifully with lime and ginger. The drink had a refreshing, earthy tone with just enough kick from the ginger ale. We also shared Coffee or Me?, which was made with Thai iced coffee, vanilla vodka, Kahl√∫a, Godiva, and cream. Thai iced coffee (oliang) is usually brewed with strong robusta beans and sweetened with condensed milk. Here, it was turned into a dessert cocktail, rich and layered, but not too sweet ,chocolatey and creamy in the best way.

For starters, we had the THEP Platter: a sampler of spring rolls, chive pancakes, crab rangoons, fried chicken dumplings, and fried shrimp dumplings. Each item had a crispy exterior and well-balanced filling. The crab rangoons, while originally Chinese-American, have become a common fusion item in Thai-American restaurants. The chive pancakes were savory and chewy, commonly found in Thai street markets under the name khanom gui chai.

The Papaya Salad (som tum) came next. This dish originates from Thailand‚Äôs northeastern region, Isan, and traditionally includes green papaya, long beans, tomato, peanuts, chili, lime, and pla ra (fermented fish sauce). It‚Äôs known for its sharp, pungent, and spicy flavor. The version here was more muted‚Äîfresh and crunchy, but the fish sauce and spice level were gentler, which made it more approachable, though slightly less authentic in intensity.

The Tom Yum Soup was done very well. This is a national dish of Thailand, and the shrimp version (tom yum goong) is one of the most recognized Thai soups globally. It had the signature lemongrass and galangal notes, balanced with lime and chili. The addition of coconut milk isn‚Äôt always traditional but adds a creamy texture that rounds out the heat and makes the soup feel more luxurious.

For mains, my friend had the Khao Pad Pu‚Äîcrab fried rice served in a coconut shell. Fried rice (khao pad) is a common Thai comfort food, often cooked in a wok with fish sauce, garlic, egg, and vegetables. Here, it was elevated with sweet chunks of fresh crab and actual coconut meat scraped from the shell, which added a natural, light sweetness. The dish came with a spicy seafood sauce on the side, providing that traditional chili-lime-fish sauce punch.

The chicken red curry was also a standout. Gaeng phed is made from red chili paste, coconut milk, kaffir lime leaves, and often Thai eggplant or bamboo shoots. This version was creamy, aromatic, and had just the right amount of heat not overwhelming, but enough to highlight the richness of the curry paste. The chicken was tender and had absorbed the flavors well.

I had the Ogg Pla Pan, a lesser-known but deeply flavorful dish. The branzino was seared well, but the shrimp paste curry it was served in was very bold rich with fermented fish sauce, dried chili, Thai herbs, and balanced with eggplant and cherry tomatoes. The sauce was intense and leaned salty, which could slightly mask the fish‚Äôs natural taste. It was still a very interesting dish for those who enjoy the deeper flavors typical of Southern Thai cuisine, where fermented seafood products are commonly used to create depth.

Overall an amazing experience, will definitely be back.

I have been coming here for almost 4 years now, and this is honestly my favorite Thai food in the area.
For the value of money, this is one of the best. I have tried a few items on the menu, and all of them have been excellent. It has a good amount of spiciness, and flavor.
Drinks there were on point too!
Would recommend it to anyone who enjoys spicy food, flavor, and a good modern Thai restaurant.

Thep absolutely lives up to the hype!

Firstly, it's noticeably clean, which always makes me feel better about dining out when I can tell a restaurant is serious about cleanliness. The service was excellent and each staff member was attentive and polite. Our server Gift is so sweet!

I‚Äôve had their Thai ice tea as well as their rose Thai tea that was extremely refreshing on a hot day, perfectly sweet, and rosey. Our appetizers were the spring rolls and papaya salad, both vegetarian but still very flavorful and hearty.
I had the red curry with chicken, which was phenomenal. It was a very tolerable spicy red curry that paired well with the chicken and vegetables in the dish.

I really loved my experience at Thep Thai, and I am looking forward to coming here again!
Came here after THE MET visit. Call here before we come because of big group. The crab fried rice is good. Ms Four is very nice .

I chose the place based on ratings and it turned out to be Thai cuisine. I ordered a shrimp pasta dish just by tapping on a picture I liked from their Instagram.

They brought exactly what I saw in the photo.
And it was delicious‚ÄîI enjoyed every bite.

Special thanks to Sasha, a sweet Thai girl who helped me choose a cocktail. It turned out great.

Really happy with the experience. I‚Äôll be back.
Loved everything. Got the Gaeng Phed Ped Yarng as well as the Chicken Satay. It was probably the best Thai cuisine I‚Äôve had in NYC! My server, Kade, had an extremely welcoming attitude as well.
